summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorneys and attorneys representing two alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein, coordinating interviews and a video conference for the victims to provide reports. It also mentions a scheduled court hearing regarding the dismissal of the indictment following Epstein's death.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.context: Attorney coordinating interview schedules and travel for two clients who are alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein. She communicates with the U.S. Attorney's office.

persons.name: Colleen Mullen
persons.context: Appears to be coordinating logistics (conference lines, travel) for victim interviews with the U.S. Attorney's Office. Copied on many emails.

persons.name: Arick Fudali
persons.context: New York attorney who will accompany one of the alleged victims (Ms. [redacted]) to her in-person interview with the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (19 Cr. 490). The emails discuss victim reports against him and note his death has led to a hearing on dismissing the indictment.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: Judge who scheduled a hearing regarding the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein following his death. The order allowed victims to be heard.

connections.description: Attorneys communicating to coordinate victim interviews and logistics for the U.S. Attorney's Office investigation.
Both are attorneys working together to represent alleged victims; Fudali is to accompany one client to an interview.
Gibbs represents clients who are alleged victims of Epstein, making her professionally opposed to him in the legal context.

events.title: Scheduled in-person victim interview
events.description: Planned interview between the U.S. Attorney's Office and an alleged victim (Ms. [redacted]), accompanied by attorney Arick Fudali.

events.title: Scheduled video conference victim interview
events.description: Planned video conference interview between the U.S. Attorney's Office and an alleged victim located in Japan (Ms. [redacted]).

events.title: Court hearing on dismissal of indictment
events.description: Judge Berman scheduled a hearing to address the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein in light of his death. Victims were allowed to be heard.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
500 Pearl Street courthouse, Courtroom 17B, New York, NY
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was actively scheduling interviews with at least two alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein in August 2019, shortly after his death.
One alleged victim was to be interviewed in person in New York, while another, located in Japan, was to be interviewed via video conference.
The attorneys for the victims provided photographs from 2004 of their clients and asked if they appeared in any photo files seized from Epstein's home.
A court hearing was scheduled for August 27, 2019, to address dismissing the indictment against Epstein posthumously, with provisions for victims to address the court.
The email chain demonstrates the ongoing investigation and victim engagement by the Southern District of New York even after Epstein's death.
